page.title: 02Alston Moor 03720546 North
page.content: Three kilometres from the town the A689 road links up to the B6294 which runs in a north westerly direction up a steep incline. To the south of this road there is a steep slope down which is mainly rough pasture land. In the valley between the two roads runs the{River Nent,}a tributary of the River South Tyne. There are several small plantations, mainly of conifers and the council tip is situated in a disused quarry. To the north of the B6294 lies the higher ground of steep rocky pasture with much evidence of past{mining activities. Beyond that lies a large area of open moorland and bog. Newshield Moss, rises to 1642 feet above sea level and it is here that the town's television mast is located.
